intro: Dampiera incana var. fuscescens, commonly known as the grey daisy, is a perennial herb native to south-eastern Australia. It is characterized by its silver-blue foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its aromatic leaves. This species is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
